ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
The Atmospheric data Community Toolkit (ACT) is an open source Python toolkit for working
with atmospheric time-series datasets of varying dimensions. The toolkit is meant to have
functions for every part of the scientific process; discovery, IO, quality control,
corrections, retrievals, visualization, and analysis. It is meant to be a community platform
for sharing code with the goal of reducing duplication of effort and better connecting the
science community with programs such as the Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) User Facility.
about.summary: Python library for working with atmospheric time-series by n-dimension datasets

about.description:
The Atmospheric data Community Toolkit (ACT) is an open source Python toolkit for working
with atmospheric time-series datasets of varying dimensions. The toolkit is meant to have
functions for every part of the scientific process; discovery, IO, quality control,
corrections, retrievals, visualization, and analysis. It is meant to be a community platform
for sharing code with the goal of reducing duplication of effort and better connecting the
science community with programs such as the Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) User Facility.
about.summary: Python library for working with atmospheric time-series by n-dimension datasets

name: act-atmos
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "act-atmos" %}
{% set version = "2.3.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name.replace('-', '_') }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c07418232d3e2bbdb1910c6cd05a1f7572cfe1a0041307bf00819a59a5b15955

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
    - setuptools_scm
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - pyproj
    - sgp4 >=2.23
    - pandas
    - xarray
    - matplotlib-base
    - numpy
    - scipy
    - dask
    - pint
    - metpy
    - netcdf4
    - six
    - lxml
    - requests
    - skyfield
    - python-dateutil
    - lazy_loader
    - fsspec
    - cmweather
    - arm-test-data
    - aiohttp

test:
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
  imports:
    - act.io
    - act.discovery
    - act.plotting
    - act.qc

about:
  home: https://github.com/ARM-DOE/ACT
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: Python library for working with atmospheric time-series by n-dimension datasets
  description: |
    The Atmospheric data Community Toolkit (ACT) is an open source Python toolkit for working 
    with atmospheric time-series datasets of varying dimensions. The toolkit is meant to have 
    functions for every part of the scientific process; discovery, IO, quality control, 
    corrections, retrievals, visualization, and analysis. It is meant to be a community platform 
    for sharing code with the goal of reducing duplication of effort and better connecting the 
    science community with programs such as the Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) User Facility.
  doc_url: https://arm-doe.github.io/ACT/
  dev_url: https://github.com/ARM-DOE/ACT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - AdamTheisen
    - rcjackson
    - zssherman
    - mgrover1
